name: Mage
description: A warlock holds a black crystalline staff. This card suggests both mental acuity and arcane magic.

person.upright: A person (perhaps a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard) who uses arcane magic or other specialized learning.
person.reverse: A person who wrongly believes their good luck is the result of innate magical ability or a magical good luck charm.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature with abilities similar to those of a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that resists or negates magic.

place.upright: A place dedicated to the study of arcane magic or that is suffused with such magic.
place.reverse: A place where magic has caused destruction, doesn't work (like the effect of an Antimagic Field), or works unpredictably (perhaps triggering wild magic surges).

treasure.upright: A magic item such as a wand or staff, or a wizard's spellbook.
treasure.reverse: An art object created by the use of magic, or a magic item with unpredictable effects (such as a Wand of Wonder).

situation.upright: A situation that requires and rewards the correct use of arcane magic.
situation.reverse: A situation caused by magic misused or out of control.
